triageFlags.title: Credit Score in Tier B
triageFlags.description: The applicant's credit score places them in Tier B, requiring stricter affordability checks.
triageFlags.recommendation: Ensure all affordability checks are thoroughly conducted and consider requesting additional documentation.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, Tier B applicants are subject to standard terms but may require stricter affordability checks due to their credit score range.

triageFlags.title: High Loan-to-Value Ratio
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio is high but within the permissible range for Tier B applicants.
triageFlags.recommendation: Verify the valuation of the vehicle and ensure the applicant can manage the financial commitment.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy allows a maximum LTV of 100% for Tier B applicants. While the current LTV is within this limit, it is relatively high, indicating a higher financial risk.

content.reasoning: The applicant's credit score places them in Tier B, which is acceptable but requires stricter affordability checks. The Loan-to-Value ratio is high but within the permissible range for Tier B. The Debt-to-Income ratio is well within the acceptable threshold, indicating affordability. However, the applicant's young age and the high LTV ratio suggest a need for careful consideration.
